[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/lending.move] [Function: liquidation()] [Return Value Swap] Line 374 returns (_bonus_balance, _excess_balance) but base_liquidation_call returns (excess_balance, obtainable_balance) at line 471 - is this intentional swap, and can callers misinterpret which balance is which? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/lending.move] [Function: liquidation_non_entry()] [Balance Ownership] liquidation_non_entry at line 377 accepts debt_balance directly instead of Coin - who owns this balance and can attacker pass arbitrary balance object not backed by real coins? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/lending.move] [Function: base_liquidation_call()] [Collateral Amount Event] Line 464 emits obtainable_amount + treasury_amount as collateral_amount, but these are computed independently via unnormal_amount - can rounding cause sum to differ from actual collateral seized? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/lending.move] [Function: withdraw_with_account_cap()] [Unauthorized Withdrawal] Line 503 allows withdrawal using account_cap without checking current cap holder matches account_owner - if account_cap is transferred, can new holder withdraw original owner's funds? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/lending.move] [Function: borrow_with_account_cap()] [Borrow Authority] Line 515 permits borrow via account_cap - if cap is stolen or transferred, can attacker borrow against victim's collateral and send funds to attacker's address?
